title: What is the difference between pay tribute and pay homage? - Quora

response.answer_text: A tribute (often explicitly) displays admiration and esteem of someone or something. For example, a tribute could be a band covering a famous song. Paying homage also displays admiration and esteem, but most often for historical events, movements, and figures, and usually (but not always) does so externally. For example, a poet could incorporate Shakespeare’s prose into a verse, paying homage to his style through allusion. The etymology behind ‘paying homage’ essentially denotes an act of service in vassalage. So here, you can think of the modern equivalent as that of ‘paying your dues’ or ‘giving credit’ to something larger than yourself. Both are out of respect, while dependant on context, can be used to describe how directly said respected entity is being acknowledged.
To homage is to pledge reverence; to tribute is to give testimony or compliment. You can easily find this is a dictionary or Wikipedia.
